verbs.description: [ARGM-TMP: Long before the time of Fu Hi] , [ARG1: Dschu Yung , the Magic Welder] , [V: was] [ARG2: the ruler of men] .
[ARG0: He] [V: discovered] [ARG1: the use of fire] , and succeeding generations learned from him to cook their food .
[ARG0: He] discovered the use of fire , and [V: succeeding] [ARG1: generations learned from him to cook their food] .
He discovered the use of fire , and succeeding [ARG1: generations] [V: learned] [ARG2: from him] [ARG1: to cook their food] .

[ARGM-DIS: Hence] [ARG1: his descendants] [V: were] [ARG2: intrusted with the preservation of fire] , [ARGM-ADV: while he himself was made the Fire - God] .

Hence his descendants were intrusted with the preservation of fire , while he himself [V: was] made the Fire - God .
Hence his descendants were intrusted with the preservation of fire , while he himself was [V: made] [ARG1: the Fire - God] .
[ARG1: He] [V: is] [ARG2: a personification of the Red Lord , who showed himself at the beginning of the world as one of the Five Ancients] .
He is a personification of [ARG0: the Red Lord] , [R-ARG0: who] [V: showed] [ARG1: himself] [ARGM-LOC: at the beginning of the world] [ARG2: as one of the Five Ancients] .
The Fire - God [V: is] worshiped as the Lord of the Holy Southern Mountain .
[ARG1: The Fire - God] is [V: worshiped] [ARGM-PRD: as the Lord of the Holy Southern Mountain] .
[ARGM-LOC: In the skies the Fiery Star] , [ARG0: the southern quarter of the heavens and the Red Bird] [V: belong] [ARG1: to his domain] .
[ARGM-TMP: When] there [V: is] [ARG1: danger of fire] the Fiery Star glows with a peculiar radiance .
[ARGM-TMP: When there is danger of fire] [ARG0: the Fiery Star] [V: glows] [ARG1: with a peculiar radiance] .
[ARGM-TMP: When] [ARG1: countless numbers of fire - crows] [V: fly] [ARGM-DIR: into a house] , a fire is sure to break out in it .
[ARGM-TMP: When countless numbers of fire - crows fly into a house] , [ARG1: a fire] [V: is] [ARG2: sure to break out in it] .
When countless numbers of fire - crows fly into a house , [ARG1: a fire] is sure to [V: break] out [ARGM-LOC: in it] .
[ARGM-LOC: In the land of the four rivers there] [V: dwelt] [ARG1: a man who was very rich] .
In the land of the four rivers there dwelt [ARG1: a man] [R-ARG1: who] [V: was] [ARG2: very rich] .
[ARGM-TMP: One day] [ARG1: he] [V: got] [ARG2: into his wagon] and set out on a long journey .
[ARGM-TMP: One day] [ARG0: he] got into his wagon and [V: set] out [ARGM-LOC: on a long journey] .
[ARGM-DIS: And] [ARG0: he] [V: met] [ARG1: a girl , dressed in red , who begged him to take her with him] .
And he met [ARG1: a girl] , [V: dressed] [ARG2: in red] , who begged him to take her with him .
And he met [ARG0: a girl , dressed in red] , [R-ARG0: who] [V: begged] [ARG1: him] [ARG2: to take her with him] .
And he met a girl , dressed in red , who begged [ARG0: him] to [V: take] [ARG1: her] [ARG2: with him] .
[ARG0: He] [V: allowed] [ARG1: her to get into the wagon] , and drove along for half - a - day without even looking in her direction .
He allowed [ARG1: her] to [V: get] [ARG2: into the wagon] , and drove along for half - a - day without even looking in her direction .
[ARG0: He] allowed her to get into the wagon , and [V: drove] [ARGM-DIR: along] [ARGM-TMP: for half - a - day] [ARGM-MNR: without even looking in her direction] .
He allowed her to get into the wagon , and drove along for half - a - day without [ARGM-ADV: even] [V: looking] [ARG1: in her direction] .
[ARGM-TMP: Then] [ARG0: the girl] [V: got] out [ARGM-TMP: again] and said in farewell : " You are truly a good and honest man , and for that reason I must tell you the truth .
[ARGM-TMP: Then] [ARG0: the girl] got out again and [V: said] [ARGM-MNR: in farewell] : " [ARG1: You are truly a good and honest man , and for that reason I must tell you the truth] .

[ARG1: I] [V: am] [ARG2: the Fire - God] .
[ARGM-MNR: To] - [V: morrow] [ARG1: a fire] will break out in your house .

[V: Hurry] [ARG4: home] [ARGM-TMP: at once] [ARGM-PRP: to arrange your affairs and save what you can] ! "
Hurry home at once to [V: arrange] [ARG1: your affairs] and save what you can ! "
Hurry home at once to arrange your affairs and [V: save] [ARG1: what you can] ! "

[ARGM-DIS: Frightened] , [ARG0: the man] [V: faced] [ARG1: his horses about] and drove home as fast as he could .
[ARGM-DIS: Frightened] , [ARG0: the man] faced his horses about and [V: drove] [ARG1: home] [ARGM-MNR: as fast as he could] .
Frightened , the man faced his horses about and drove home as fast as he [V: could] .
[ARG1: All] [R-ARG1: that] [ARG0: he] [V: possessed] [ARGM-MNR: in the way of treasures , clothes and jewels] , he removed from the house .
[ARG1: All that he possessed in the way of treasures , clothes and jewels] , [ARG0: he] [V: removed] [ARG2: from the house] .
And , [ARGM-TMP: when] [ARG1: he] [V: was] [ARG2: about to lie down to sleep] , a fire broke out on the hearth which could not be quenched until the whole building had collapsed in dust and ashes .
And , when [ARG1: he] was about to [V: lie] down [ARGM-PRP: to sleep] , a fire broke out on the hearth which could not be quenched until the whole building had collapsed in dust and ashes .
